meanings.sent1: The king's ukase declared a new law for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The president issued an ukase to ban smoking in public places.
meanings.sent3: The ukase from the principal stated that all students must wear uniforms on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: Her ukase to always speak the truth was a guiding principle in her life.
meanings.sent5: The ukase of the judge rang through the courtroom, silencing all chatter.

meanings.definition: A command or order issued by a ruler or government.
meanings.sent1: The ukase from the queen demanded all citizens to pay their taxes on time.
meanings.sent2: The military general's ukase was to advance towards the enemy's territory.
meanings.sent3: The ukase to have dessert before dinner puzzled the guests at the royal banquet.
meanings.sent4: The ukase to evacuate the city before the storm hit saved many lives.
meanings.sent5: The ukase of the emperor was followed without question by his subjects.
